00034 class ConstValueAdapter: public util::ValueReference
00035 {
00036 public:
00037     typedef const util::ValueReference ( *Getter )( const void * );
00038     typedef void ( *Setter )( void *, const util::_internal::ValueBase & );
00039 protected:
00040     const uint8_t *const p;
00041 public:
00042     ConstValueAdapter( const uint8_t *const _p, Getter _getValueFunc );
00043     // to make some algorithms work
00044     bool operator==( const util::ValueReference &val )const;
00045     bool operator!=( const util::ValueReference &val )const;
00046 
00047     bool operator<( const util::ValueReference &val )const;
00048     bool operator>( const util::ValueReference &val )const;
00049 };
00050 class WritingValueAdapter: public ConstValueAdapter
00051 {
00052     Setter setValueFunc;
00053 public:
00054     WritingValueAdapter( uint8_t *const _p, Getter _getValueFunc, Setter _setValueFunc );
00055     WritingValueAdapter operator=( const util::ValueReference &val );

00057 
00058 template<bool IS_CONST> class GenericValueIterator :
00059     public std::iterator < std::random_access_iterator_tag,
00060     typename boost::mpl::if_c<IS_CONST, ConstValueAdapter, WritingValueAdapter>::type,
00061     ptrdiff_t,
00062     typename boost::mpl::if_c<IS_CONST, ConstValueAdapter, WritingValueAdapter>::type,
00063     typename boost::mpl::if_c<IS_CONST, ConstValueAdapter, WritingValueAdapter>::type
00064     >
00065 {
00066     typedef typename boost::mpl::if_c<IS_CONST, const uint8_t *, uint8_t *>::type ptr_type;
00067     ptr_type p, start; //we need the starting position for operator[]
00068     size_t byteSize;
00069     ConstValueAdapter::Getter getValueFunc;
00070     ConstValueAdapter::Setter setValueFunc;
00071     friend class GenericValueIterator<true>; //yes, I'm my own friend, sometimes :-) (enables the constructor below)
00072 public:
00073     GenericValueIterator( const GenericValueIterator<false> &src ): //will become additional constructor from non const if this is const, otherwise overrride the default copy contructor
00074         p( src.p ), start( src.p ), byteSize( src.byteSize ), getValueFunc( src.getValueFunc ), setValueFunc( src.setValueFunc ) {}
00075     GenericValueIterator(): p( NULL ), start( p ), byteSize( 0 ), getValueFunc( NULL ), setValueFunc( NULL ) {}
00076     GenericValueIterator( ptr_type _p, ptr_type _start, size_t _byteSize, ConstValueAdapter::Getter _getValueFunc, ConstValueAdapter::Setter _setValueFunc ):
00077         p( _p ), start( _start ), byteSize( _byteSize ), getValueFunc( _getValueFunc ), setValueFunc( _setValueFunc )
00078     {}
00079 
00080     GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST>& operator++() {p += byteSize; return *this;}
00081     GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST>& operator--() {p -= byteSize; return *this;}
00082 
00083     GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST> operator++( int ) {GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST> tmp = *this; ++*this; return tmp;}
00084     GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST> operator--( int ) {GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST> tmp = *this; --*this; return tmp;}
00085 
00086     typename GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST>::reference operator*() const;
00087     typename GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST>::pointer  operator->() const {return operator*();}
00088 
00089     bool operator==( const GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST>& cmp )const {return p == cmp.p;}
00090     bool operator!=( const GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST>& cmp )const {return !( *this == cmp );}
00091 
00092     bool operator>( const GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST> &cmp )const {return p > cmp.p;}
00093     bool operator<( const GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST> &cmp )const {return p < cmp.p;}
00094 
00095     bool operator>=( const GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST> &cmp )const {return p >= cmp.p;}
00096     bool operator<=( const GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST> &cmp )const {return p <= cmp.p;}
00097 
00098     typename GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST>::difference_type operator-( const GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST> &cmp )const {return ( p - cmp.p ) / byteSize;}
00099 
00100     GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST> operator+( typename GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST>::difference_type n )const
00101     {return ( GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST>( *this ) += n );}
00102     GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST> operator-( typename GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST>::difference_type n )const
00103     {return ( GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST>( *this ) -= n );}
00104 
00105 
00106     GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST> &operator+=( typename GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST>::difference_type n )
00107     {p += ( n * byteSize ); return *this;}
00108     GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST> &operator-=( typename GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST>::difference_type n )
00109     {p -= ( n * byteSize ); return *this;}
00110 
00111     typename GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST>::reference operator[]( typename GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST>::difference_type n )const {
00112         //the book says it has to be the n-th elements of the whole object, so we have to start from what is hopefully the beginning
00113         return *( GenericValueIterator<IS_CONST>( start, start, byteSize, getValueFunc, setValueFunc ) += n );
00114     }
00115 
00116 };
00117 //specialise the dereferencing operators. They have to return (and create) different objects with different constructors
00118 template<> GenericValueIterator<true>::reference GenericValueIterator<true>::operator*() const;
00119 template<> GenericValueIterator<false>::reference GenericValueIterator<false>::operator*() const;

00230 
00241     template<typename T> bool copyToMem( T *dst, size_t len, scaling_pair scaling = scaling_pair() )const {
00242         ValuePtr<T> cont( dst, len, typename ValuePtr<T>::NonDeleter() );
00243         return copyTo( cont, scaling );
00244     }
00245 
00256     template<typename T> bool copyFromMem( const T *const src, size_t len, scaling_pair scaling = scaling_pair() ) {
00257         ValuePtr<T> cont( const_cast<T *>( src ), len, typename ValuePtr<T>::NonDeleter() ); //its ok - we're no going to change it
00258         return cont.copyTo( *this, scaling );
00259     }

00275     template<typename T> ValuePtr<T> copyAs( scaling_pair scaling = scaling_pair() )const {
00276         Reference erg = copyByID( ValuePtr<T>::staticID, scaling );
00277         return erg.isEmpty() ? ValuePtr<T>( 0 ) : erg->castToValuePtr<T>();
00278     }

00306     template<typename T> ValuePtr<T> as( scaling_pair scaling = scaling_pair() ) {
00307         Reference erg = convertByID( ValuePtr<T>::staticID, scaling );
00308         return erg.isEmpty() ? ValuePtr<T>( 0 ) : erg->castToValuePtr<T>();
00309     }
